page.title: 16ECOLOGY GODMERSHAM SURROUNDS
page.content: Park Wood, with hornbeam, oak, beech, yew field maple and coppiced hazel and chestnut, is a site of 'special scientific interest'. It shelters rare insects such as Melandrya caraboides beetle, Stratimys potamida, a fly, and the wasp, Crosserus distinguenda. Rare in kent is Acicula fusca a snail of this wood. Fallow deer, badgers and foxes are numerous, muntjack few, while adders and slow worms are common. Many birds including nghtingales breed in the valley. Annual rainfall, higher than on the nearby coast, is about 80cm. The valley is a frost pocket unusually severe weather in 1985 killed many well established plants.
